onset.Description: timepoint that stimulus appears on screen that matches scan timeseries

duration.Description: period of time during which stimulus was on screen
duration.Notes: This task was self-paced, so duration for trial_id == 'stim' correspond to response_time. Duration for trial_id == 'feedback' was 1 followed by variable length of blank screen (ITI).

planning.Description: whether planning time for entire round is included in current trial

Levels.1: planning time is included in current trial
Levels.0: planning time is not included in current trial

planning.Notes: participants were instructed to plan all movements in advance and execute them as quickly as possible. the first trial of each round will have planning time included

Levels.UA_with_intermediate: unambiguous trial that requires intermediate moves
Levels.UA_without_intermediate: unambiguous trial that does not require intermediate moves
Levels.PA_with_intermediate: partially ambiguous trial that requires intermediate moves
Levels.PA_without_intermediate: partially ambiguous trial that does not require intermediate moves

current_position.Description: current state of balls on peg. Each three numbers sequentially represent 3 possible positions on each peg. 0 = empty position / 1,2,3 = label for specific balls.

Levels.test: main test portion of the task

goal_state.Description: goal state of balls on peg. Each three numbers sequentially represent 3 possible positions on each peg. 0 = empty position / 1,2,3 = label for specific balls.

key_press.Notes: 89 was coded for index finger responses, 71 for middle finger responses, and 82 for ring finger responses

start_state.Description: start state of balls on peg. Each three numbers sequentially represent 3 possible positions on each peg. 0 = empty position / 1,2,3 = label for specific balls.
